body.p:
Hd Qrs 1st Ky Cav
June 30" 1864.
Gov Bramlette
Sir

I received a Communication from the Adjt Genls office Calling for an official Copy of the ^acceptance of the^ resignations of major Drye, Capts Fishback & Smith. I send herewith those for Drye & Smith. And as only one Copy was furnished this office in refference to Fishbacks He himself took it with him to enable him to draw pay. But his resignation was accepted to take date from June 9" 1864.

I will again Call your attention to the recommendation of Capt Rowland for major vice Drye resigned and of Lt Roberts to be made Capt Co "K" vice Rowland promoted. and Lt S, N, Bruner to be made 1st Lt vice Roberts promoted Also Lt I. D. Batie to be made Capt Co "L" vice Fishback resigned. & orderly Sergt ^G. I.^ Vaught to be made 2nd Lt Co 'L" vice Batie promoted. Also Lt Pankey to be made Capt of Co "I" vice Smith promotedresigned & Thos Graves to be made 2nd Lt vice Pankey promoted
Enclosed herein please find recommenda^tions^ for Maj Helveti to be made Lt Col, and Capt Keen to be Major vice Helveti promoted.

I will also recommend to you for promotion 1st Lt John. C. McLain to be Capt Co "I" vice Keen promoted. & order 2nd Lt A. C. Smith to be 1st Lt vice McLain promoted & orderly Sergt Sandusky Bruton to be 2nd Lt vice Smith promoted.

I am very Resptly
Your obt Servt
Silas Adams Col
Col Comdg Regt.

By
W. D. Carpenter
Adjt
1st Ky Cav

1 Lieut Jno C. McLain to be Capt Coy I. 1 Cavy June 30. 1864 vice A. S. Keene promo
1. 2. 3. 4

2 Lieut A. C. Smith com 1 Lieut Coy I. 1 Cavy June 30. 1864 vice Jno C. McCLain promo
1. 2. 3. 4

O. S. Sandusky Bruton com 2 Lt. Coy I. 1 Cavy June 30. 1864 vice A. C. Smith promo.
1. 2. 3. 4

1' Cavy
Head Qrs 1s Ky Cavy
June 30. 1864.
Adams Silas
Colonel.

Encloses copies of the order accepting the resignation of Maj. Drye and Capt. Smith. asks that Commissions for Officers heretofore recommended to fill their places be issued and also recommends sundry other officers for Commission.

Com Issd & forwd
July 9. 1864
Recd A. G. O. July 6. 1864
